entry.title: intel/openvino-plugins-ai-audacity
entry.summary:
A set of AI-enabled effects, generators, and analyzers for AudacityÂ®.

OpenVINOâ„¢ AI Plugins for Audacity* ğŸ¤˜

A set of AI-enabled effects, generators, and analyzers for AudacityÂ®. These AI features run 100% locally on your PC ğŸ’» -- no internet connection necessary! OpenVINOâ„¢ is used to run AI models on supported accelerators found on the user's system such as CPU, GPU, and NPU.

  • Music SeparationğŸµ -- Separate a mono or stereo track into individual stems -- Drums, Bass, Vocals, & Other Instruments.
  • Noise SuppressionğŸ§¹ -- Removes background noise from an audio sample.
  • Music Generation & ContinuationğŸ¶ -- Uses MusicGen LLM to generate snippets of music, or to generate a continuation of an existing snippet of music.
  • Whisper TranscriptionğŸ¤ -- Uses whisper.cpp to generate a label track containing the transcription or translation for a given selection of spoken audio or vocals.

Installation ğŸ’¾

Go here to find installation packages & instructions for the latest Windows release.

Build Instructions ğŸ”¨

  • Windows Build Instructions
  • Linux Build Instructions

Help, Feedback, & Bug Reports ğŸ™‹â€â™‚ï¸

We welcome you to submit an issue here for

  • Questions
  • Bug Reports
  • Feature Requests
  • Feedback of any kind -- how can we improve this project?

Contribution ğŸ¤

Your contributions are welcome and valued, no matter how big or small. Feel free to submit a pull-request!

Acknowledgements & Citations ğŸ™

  • AudacityÂ® development team & Muse Group-- Thank you for your support!
  • AudacityÂ® GitHub -- https://github.com/audacity/audacity
  • Whisper transcription & translation analyzer uses whisper.cpp (with OpenVINOâ„¢ backend): https://github.com/ggerganov/whisper.cpp
  • Music Generation & Continuation use MusicGen model, from Meta.
    • We currently have support for MusicGen-Small, and MusicGen-Small-Stereo
    • The txt-to-music pipelines were ported from python to C++, referencing logic from the Hugging Face transformers project: https://github.com/huggingface/transformers
  • Music Separation effect uses Meta's Demucs v4 model (https://github.com/facebookresearch/demucs), which has been ported to work with OpenVINOâ„¢
  • Noise Suppression:
    • noise-suppression-denseunet-ll: from OpenVINOâ„¢'s Open Model Zoo: https://github.com/openvinotoolkit/open_model_zoo
    • DeepFilterNet2 & DeepFilterNet3:
      • Ported the models & pipeline from here: https://github.com/Rikorose/DeepFilterNet
      • We also made use of @grazder's fork / branch (https://github.com/grazder/DeepFilterNet/tree/torchDF-changes) to better understand the Rust implementation, and so we also based some of our C++ implementation on torch_df_offline.py found here.
      • Citations: 
        @inproceedings{schroeter2022deepfilternet2,
title = {{DeepFilterNet2}: Towards Real-Time Speech Enhancement on Embedded Devices for Full-Band Audio},
author = {SchrÃ¶ter, Hendrik and Escalante-B., Alberto N. and Rosenkranz, Tobias and Maier, Andreas},
booktitle={17th International Workshop on Acoustic Signal Enhancement (IWAENC 2022)},
year = {2022},
}
  
@inproceedings{schroeter2023deepfilternet3,
title = {{DeepFilterNet}: Perceptually Motivated Real-Time Speech Enhancement},
author = {SchrÃ¶ter, Hendrik and Rosenkranz, Tobias and Escalante-B., Alberto N. and Maier, Andreas},
booktitle={INTERSPEECH},
year = {2023},
}
  • OpenVINOâ„¢ Notebooks -- We have learned a lot from this awesome set of python notebooks, and are still using it to learn latest / best practices for implementing AI pipelines using OpenVINOâ„¢!
